com.starsoft.serviseutil.alarmutil

Class AlarmManagerUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.starsoft.serviseutil.alarmutil.AlarmManagerUtil

  • public class AlarmManagerUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    A helper class for launching services or receiver using Alarm Manager on different versions of Android
    Version:
    1.0
    See Also:
    https://habr.com/post/274169/

      • cancelAlarm

        public static void cancelAlarm(android.content.Context context,
                               android.content.Intent intent,
                               int identifier)
        Cancel Starts the item if it is not started
        Parameters:
        context - The Context in which this PendingIntent should start
        intent - An Intent describing the item to be started.
        identifier - Unique identifier

      • isBroadcastAlarmOn

        public static boolean isBroadcastAlarmOn(android.content.Context context,
                                         android.content.Intent intent,
                                         int identifier)
        Checks whether a deferred task to run the service
        Parameters:
        context - The Context in which this PendingIntent should start
        intent - An Intent describing the service to be started.
        identifier - Unique identifier
        Returns:
        Returns true if the service exists and is not already running, otherwise false

      • isServiceAlarmOn

        public static boolean isServiceAlarmOn(android.content.Context context,
                                       android.content.Intent intent,
                                       int identifier)
        Checks whether a deferred task to run the receiver
        Parameters:
        context - The Context in which this PendingIntent should start
        intent - An Intent describing the receiver to be started.
        identifier - Unique identifier
        Returns:
        Returns true if the receiver exists and is not already running, otherwise false

      • setBroadcastAlarm

        public static long setBroadcastAlarm(android.content.Context context,
                                     android.content.Intent intent,
                                     long timeInterval,
                                     int identifier)
        Starts the broadcast service at the expiration of the time interval previous run cancelled
        Parameters:
        context - The Context in which this PendingIntent should start
        intent - An Intent describing the receiver to be started.
        timeInterval - The time through which will run the receiver, milliseconds
        identifier - Unique identifier
        Returns:
        Returns a time when it was installed, milliseconds, time since January 1 1970

      • setServiceAlarm

        public static long setServiceAlarm(android.content.Context context,
                                   android.content.Intent intent,
                                   long timeInterval,
                                   int identifier)
        Starts the service at the expiration of the time interval previous run cancelled
        Parameters:
        context - The Context in which this PendingIntent should start
        intent - An Intent describing the service to be started.
        timeInterval - The time through which will run the service, milliseconds
        identifier - Unique identifier
        Returns:
        Returns a time when it was installed, milliseconds, time since January 1 1970

      • setUpAlarm

        protected static long setUpAlarm(android.app.AlarmManager alarmManager,
                                 android.app.PendingIntent pi,
                                 long timeInterval)
        Setup the Alarm Manager task at the expiration of the time interval
        Parameters:
        alarmManager - The instance of Alarm Manager
        pi - An PendingIntent describing the receiver to be started.
        timeInterval - The time through which will run the receiver, milliseconds
        Returns:
        Returns a time when it was installed, milliseconds, time since January 1 1970
